meanings.definition: A medical instrument used to examine the larynx.
meanings.sent1: The doctor used a laryngoscope to look at my throat.
meanings.sent2: The laryngoscope helped the ENT specialist see inside the throat clearly.
meanings.sent3: When the laryngoscope made a funny noise, I couldn't stop giggling.
meanings.sent4: The laryngoscope was like a tiny flashlight exploring the depths of my throat.
meanings.sent5: The shiny laryngoscope gleamed under the bright hospital lights.

meanings.definition: To examine the larynx using a laryngoscope.
meanings.sent1: The doctor will laryngoscope your throat to check for any issues.
meanings.sent2: She laryngoscopes patients regularly to ensure their vocal cords are healthy.
meanings.sent3: I tried to laryngoscope my own throat in the mirror, but it was tricky!
meanings.sent4: His curiosity laryngoscoped every corner of the patient's larynx.
meanings.sent5: The surgeon skillfully laryngoscoped, revealing the source of the problem.
